@graph.description: An authentic version of Pork with Garlic Sauce or Yu Xiang Rou Si (鱼香肉丝) involves just three main ingredients: pork, wood ear mushrooms, and celtuce, the stem part of a lettuce plant

itemListElement.name: Pork with Garlic Sauce (鱼香肉丝）

@graph.headline: Pork with Garlic Sauce (鱼香肉丝）

@graph.name: Judy
@graph.description: Judy is the mom of The Woks of Life family. Born in Shanghai, she arrived in the U.S. at age 16. Fluent in both English and three separate Chinese dialects, she's our professional menu translator when we're eating our way through China. Dedicated to preserving disappearing recipes and traditions, her specialty is all things traditional, from mooncakes to home-style stir-fries.

@graph.name: Pork with Garlic Sauce - Authentic Yu Xiang Rou Si
@graph.description: An authentic version of Pork with Garlic Sauce involves just three main ingredients: pork, wood ear mushrooms, and celtuce, the stem part of a lettuce plant
recipeIngredient: 1  heaping cup of rehydrated wood ears ((julienned))
8 ounces celtuce ((stem lettuce, peeled and julienned, may also substitute bamboo shoots or carrots))

recipeInstructions.text: First, combine the pork with the marinade ingredients, and set aside for 20 minutes while you prepare the ingredients for the rest of the dish--namely, the celtuce, wood ears, ginger, garlic, etc.
recipeInstructions.name: First, combine the pork with the marinade ingredients, and set aside for 20 minutes while you prepare the ingredients for the rest of the dish--namely, the celtuce, wood ears, ginger, garlic, etc.

recipeInstructions.text: Next, prepare the sauce--mix all of the sauce ingredients together and set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Next, prepare the sauce--mix all of the sauce ingredients together and set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: Now we can start cooking! To prevent sticking, preheat a clean wok until it starts to smoke lightly (this step is very important). Now turn up the heat to high, and add one tablespoon of oil to the wok. Cook the marinated pork just until it turns opaque. Turn off the heat, transfer the pork to a dish, and set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Now we can start cooking! To prevent sticking, preheat a clean wok until it starts to smoke lightly (this step is very important). Now turn up the heat to high, and add one tablespoon of oil to the wok. Cook the marinated pork just until it turns opaque. Turn off the heat, transfer the pork to a dish, and set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: At this stage, your wok should still be pretty clean, as the technique used to cook the pork is fairly low impact. But if it’s not, it’s a good idea to wash the wok and wipe it dry before starting the next phase of cooking.
recipeInstructions.name: At this stage, your wok should still be pretty clean, as the technique used to cook the pork is fairly low impact. But if it’s not, it’s a good idea to wash the wok and wipe it dry before starting the next phase of cooking.

recipeInstructions.text: Turn the heat on to medium. Add two tablespoons of oil and the spicy bean sauce. Stir lightly, and cook for about a minute until the oil turns red, adjusting the heat to avoid burning if needed.
recipeInstructions.name: Turn the heat on to medium. Add two tablespoons of oil and the spicy bean sauce. Stir lightly, and cook for about a minute until the oil turns red, adjusting the heat to avoid burning if needed.

recipeInstructions.text: Now add the ginger, garlic, and dried chili peppers. Stir for about 15 seconds. Add the wood ears, turn up the heat, and stir fry for 30 seconds (you can add a few drops of water if it’s too dry), making sure everything is well-combined.
recipeInstructions.name: Now add the ginger, garlic, and dried chili peppers. Stir for about 15 seconds. Add the wood ears, turn up the heat, and stir fry for 30 seconds (you can add a few drops of water if it’s too dry), making sure everything is well-combined.

recipeInstructions.text: Once the liquid in the wok starts to bubble, give your sauce mixture a good stir, and add it along with the celtuce, scallion and cooked pork. Stir fry quickly to combine everything and serve.
recipeInstructions.name: Once the liquid in the wok starts to bubble, give your sauce mixture a good stir, and add it along with the celtuce, scallion and cooked pork. Stir fry quickly to combine everything and serve.
